senses.ex: She had to assemble the furniture herself because it came in parts.

Tips.title: DIY Context
Tips.description: Used when describing self-assembly of products, common in furniture or toys.
Tips.example: After moving, they had to assemble the bookshelf from the flat-pack.

Tips.title: Step by Step
Tips.description: Suggests a process with instructions or stages, often provided in a manual.
Tips.example: Refer to the manual to assemble the parts in the correct order.

Tips.title: Hands-on Activity
Tips.description: Involves physical work or activity, not just conceptual or planning stages.
Tips.example: The kids were excited to assemble the model airplane.

senses.ex: The whole team will assemble at the park by 7 am tomorrow.

Tips.title: Gathering Event
Tips.description: Often used for formal or organized events where people come together.
Tips.example: We will assemble in the conference room at noon.

Tips.title: Time Specific
Tips.description: Usually implies a specific time and place for people to meet.
Tips.example: The ceremony will begin once everyone has assembled.

senses.de: To fit together pieces of a machine
senses.ex: The engineers had to assemble the engine carefully to ensure everything ran smoothly.

Tips.title: Precision Needed
Tips.description: Accuracy is vital when assembling technical parts to avoid malfunctions.
Tips.example: Carefully assemble the parts to prevent leaks.

Tips.title: Safety First
Tips.description: Proper assembly in engineering can be critical for safety.
Tips.example: Always wear protective gear when you assemble the chemical reactor.

senses.de: To create a computer program by converting instructions into machine code
senses.ex: The programmer used an assembler to assemble the source code into binary code.

Tips.title: Programming Step
Tips.description: In computing, assembling is a step before the program is runnable.
Tips.example: After writing the code, you need to assemble it to test the software.

Tips.title: Tech Tool Required
Tips.description: A specific software tool, an assembler, is required for this process.
Tips.example: You'll need a good assembler to efficiently assemble the new app's code.

Accumulate.wordDefinition:
Accumulate means to gather or collect something gradually over a period of time.

It is often used when talking about things that build up over time, like savings or snow. For example, a person might accumulate a large amount of money in their bank account over several years.

Both words are different and applicable depending on the context in which they are used. We use accumulate when we are talking about something that is gradually built up or increased, while assemble is used when we are talking about putting different things together to create a whole.

Amass.wordDefinition:
Amass means to gather or collect a large amount of something over time.

Example: The billionaire businessman was able to amass a fortune through wise investments.

In simpler terms, amass describes accumulating a large quantity of something over time, whereas assemble means bringing things or people together for a specific purpose.

Collect.wordDefinition:
Collect means to gather things together, generally with a specific goal in mind. For example, you might collect stamps or coins as a hobby, or you might collect money for a charitable cause.

So, where assemble is applicable when you want to put things together to create something new, collect is used when you want to gather items for some specific purpose.

Congregate.wordDefinition:
Congregate means to gather in a more informal or spontaneous way, such as congregating in a park or at a concert. This implies that there may not be a specific plan or schedule in place for the people coming together.

Assemble is typically used in a more formal or organized context, while congregate is used in a more casual or spontaneous context.

Gather.wordDefinition: Gather means to collect or come together in a group or crowd, like gathering with friends or gathering information.

Marshal.wordDefinition:
Marshal means to arrange or organize things in a particular order or formation. For example, soldiers can be marshaled in a certain way for a military parade or information can be marshaled in a report to present it in a clear and organized manner.

So, while both words involve bringing things together, assemble refers to the act of gathering while marshal refers to the act of organizing.

Assemble is more commonly used to refer to physical objects or groups of people, while marshal is often used in more abstract contexts like organizing data or ideas.

Muster.wordDefinition:
Muster means to gather, especially troops or military personnel before a battle.

For example, "The general mustered his troops for battle" or "The sergeant mustered the troops for morning inspection."

Assemble is used when talking about gathering people or things in general, while muster is specifically used when talking about gathering military troops or personnel.

Round up.wordDefinition:
Round up means to gather or collect something or someone that may be difficult to find or capture, such as rounding up cattle or rounding up escaped prisoners.

Assemble is applicable when you want to gather things/people for a specific purpose, while round up is applicable when you want to gather things/people that may be more difficult to find or capture.

quotes.Text: Throughout my years, I've had the pleasure of assembling and training what I believe to be the best group of people in the world. People with the presence of mind to deal with any flare-up, including my own. People who share the belief that nothing is impossible.
quotes.Title: American Celebrity
quotes.Name: Red Adair

quotes.Text: The house I grew up in had large plate-glass windows, which birds frequently crashed into headfirst. My father helped me assemble a bird hospital, consisting of a few shoe boxes, some old rags, and tiny dishes for water and food.
quotes.Title: American Celebrity
quotes.Name: Patti Davis

quotes.Text: You know, why at the end of your life should you assemble thousands of pages of 'Why am I so sad, why am I so depressed?' Instead, assemble thousands of pages of why you're so content.
quotes.Title: American Novelist
quotes.Name: Elizabeth Gilbert

quotes.Text: Life is not a solo act. It's a huge collaboration, and we all need to assemble around us the people who care about us and support us in times of strife.
quotes.Title: American Designer
quotes.Name: Tim Gunn

quotes.Text: No sooner do we think we have assembled a comfortable life than we find a piece of ourselves that has no place to fit in.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Gail Sheehy

quotes.Text: I've never cared for guns. In fact, when I did 'Scent of a Woman' I had to learn how to assemble one.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Al Pacino

quotes.Text: My lifetime dream has been to assemble and preserve the history of the Hollywood film industry.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Debbie Reynolds

quotes.Text: It is with deep regret that the determination to assemble Parliament has been so long delayed.
quotes.Title: British Statesman
quotes.Name: Henry Addington

quotes.Text: I'm trying to assemble materials for a different mode of life.
quotes.Title: American Artist
quotes.Name: Henry Flynt

quotes.Text: We have the right to peacefully assemble in the United States.
quotes.Title: American Public Servant
quotes.Name: Morgan Ortagus
